Comment: Thankfully here its almost impossible. Both the house and the senate have to vote on it then instruct the governor general to do so.  Its legitimately easier to remove a prime minister than to remove a federal judge. We've never removed one in our relatively short history. Its not even possible for the lower house to have the debate since the high court has never even defined the terms for removal beyond 'proven misconduct or inability to perform duties'.  Even 'inability to perform' is likely never possible since all judges are forced to retire at 70 (65 in some cases)
